subject: Sir,
body:
Sir,
This email is coming to you after a serious thought concerning your
outstanding fund transfer in Ghana. My name is Mrs. Grace Aduamah the
Head of International Banking Operations, Bank of Ghana. I am
responsible for all wire remittance and final crediting to all
outgoing wire transfers at Bank of Ghana. I am compelled to contact
you directly considering the pressure, threat and blackmail directed
at my person by your associates, here in Ghana over my refusal to
authorize remittance of your inherited sum, which is still in Bank of
Ghanaâ€™s suspense account till date. Now I have been vindicated,
clearance has been issued for the wire, please confirm if you are
still alive for us to initiate the wire.
Yours Sincerely
Mrs. Grace Aduamah
International Banking Operations
Bank of Ghana
+233208744437

subject: Re: Sir,
body:
Dear Mrs. Grace Aduamah,

Thank you for reaching out to me regarding my fund transfer in Ghana. I appreciate your concern and willingness to assist me. However, I have a few questions before we proceed.

Could you please provide more details about the inherited sum that is currently in the Bank of Ghana suspense account? How did this sum come about, and who is it inherited from? Also, what is the total amount of the fund?

Additionally, you mentioned pressure, threats, and blackmail directed at you due to your refusal to authorize the remittance. Could you elaborate on this situation? Who is pressuring you, and why are they doing so?

I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Michael
